intro: Mollugo lichtensteiniana, commonly known as the sandspurry, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Molluginaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer or early autumn. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, and the plant is well adapted to hot, dry environments. Mollugo lichtensteiniana is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is a common weed in disturbed areas.
